node.title: A Young Buyer Seeks Old-Fashioned Charm in Brooklyn. Which Apartment Would You Choose?
node.alt: For her first apartment purchase, Lily Sullivan aimed to find something in a charming older building. “I wanted something with character, with a story, something that felt like a community,” Ms. Sullivan said. She had up to $600,000 to spend, and was eager to do some cosmetic work on a new place.
node.description: Coming from ‘a wild unicorn of an apartment’ in Williamsburg, this first-time buyer sought a studio or one-bedroom with vintage character — but without vintage problems. Here’s what she found.
